## Discussion

The framework times out a session if the peer user closes the app, or if too much time passes in a suspended state (see [doc://com.apple.nearbyinteraction/documentation/NearbyInteraction/NISessionDelegate/sessionWasSuspended(_:)]). NI may also time out a session to save device resources.

An app must watch for timed-out peers. If the app wishes to continue interaction with a timed-out peer device, the app must begin a new session.

# NINearbyObject.RemovalReason.timeout

**Case**

NI timed out the session.

## Declaration

```swift
case timeout
```

## Discussion

The framework times out a session if the peer user closes the app, or if too much time passes in a suspended state (see [doc://com.apple.nearbyinteraction/documentation/NearbyInteraction/NISessionDelegate/sessionWasSuspended(_:)]). NI may also time out a session to save device resources.

An app must watch for timed-out peers. If the app wishes to continue interaction with a timed-out peer device, the app must begin a new session.

## Reasons

- **NINearbyObject.RemovalReason.peerEnded**: The peer ended the session.
- **NINearbyObject.RemovalReason.peerEnded**: The peer ended the session.
title: NINearbyObject.RemovalReason.timeout
